name: Phantom
description: This App exposes various Phantom APIs as actions

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
Find artifacts containing a CEF value
Add value to a custom list
actions.verbose: To add a row containing a single value to a list simply pass the value. However, to pass multiple values in a row, format it like a JSON array (e.g. ["item1", "item2", "item3"])

list.description: Name or ID of a custom list

create.description: Create list if it does not exist

actions.description: Find value in a custom list
actions.verbose: Row and column coordinates for each matching value can be found in the result summary under "locations". The match is case sensitive.

list.description: Name or ID of a custom list

actions.description: Add a value as a new artifact
actions.verbose:
If the container_id parameter is left empty, the artifact will be added to the container the action is running on.

CEF fields can be added to the artifact in two ways, either by using the cef_name and cef_value parameter or by using the cef_dictionary parameter. If the cef_name, cef_value, and cef_dictionary parameters are all included, the action will add the cef_name field to the cef_dictionary.

Using the cef_name and cef_value parameter will result in the artifact having one CEF field. When using these parameters the contains parameter will take a string representing the contains for the cef_value parameter.

The cef_dictionary parameter takes a JSON dictionary with key-value pairs representing CEF key-value pairs.

The contains parameter also takes a JSON dictionary, with the keys matching the keys of the cef dictionary and the values being lists of possible contains for the CEF field. If a given value in the cef dictionary is not also in the contains dictionary, the action will first check the list of default CEF fields. If not a default CEF field, the action will attempt to identify the appropriate contains value.

See the REST API Documentation for more information on artifacts, CEF fields, and contains.

container_id.description: Numeric container ID for the new artifact

contains.description: Data type for each CEF field

actions.description: Deflates an item from the vault
actions.verbose: Detects if the input vault item is a compressed file and deflates it. Every file found after deflation is then added to the vault. If container_id is specified will add to its vault, else to the current (the container whose context the action is executed) container. The app supports zip, gzip, bz2, tar, and tgz file types.

actions.description: Export local container to the configured Phantom asset
actions.verbose: This action exports a container (that matches the container_id) from the local Phantom instance to the configured Phantom asset (that the action is executed on).

actions.description: Import a container from an external Phantom instance
actions.verbose: This action imports a container (that matches the container_id) from the configured Phantom asset (that the action is executed on) into the local Phantom instance.

actions.description: Create a new container on a Phantom instance
actions.verbose: This action creates a new container on the Phantom asset that this action is executed on. The container_json parameter needs to be a JSON string. The container_artifacts is an optional parameter that needs to be a list of artifact objects as a JSON string. The action will fail if the container_json has a label that doesn't exist on the destination Phantom asset.

example_values: [{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (1)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 1},{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (2)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 2},{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (3)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 3}]
{"severity": "medium", "label": "events", "version": 1, "asset": 7, "status": "new", "description": "New Container from Phantom Helper", "tags": [],  "data": {}, "name": "This is a container"}

actions.description: Find the results of a previously run action
actions.verbose:
This action returns the most recent results of an action with the given action_name launched with the given parameters within the given time_limit.

The action will limit the number of results returned to the value in max_results. By default, the limit is 10.

The parameters parameter takes a JSON string in the format:

{
    "parameter_name1": "parameter_value1"
    "parameter_name2": "parameter_value2"
    ...
}

The app parameter takes an app name, and if it is included, the action will only search for action results from that app. Similarly, the asset parameter takes an asset name, and if it is included, the action will only search for action results from that asset.

time_limit.description: Number of hours to search back

max_results.description: Maximum number of action results to return

actions.verbose: Either the list's name or id is required

row_number.description: Row number in list to be modified

row_values_as_list.description: New values for the row, separated by commas

actions.description: Wait for the specified number of seconds
